repnme.cdata!:
Cameroon - National Agricultural Extension
            and Research Program Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, achieved through
            satisfactory performances by the Bank and Borrower. Lessons
            suggest what follows. Substantial increases in yields and
            livestock productivity can be achieved with an effective
            extension management system, if linked with adaptive
            agricultural research, and modified to the conditions in a
            particular country. However, whatever system is used to
            support producers, adequate mobility for the extension and
            research staff is a precondition for obtaining results that
            are broadly based on the rural population. Adding a
            provision of funds for productive equipment, and
            infrastructure can improve the motivation to produce more,
            achieve more marketable produce, and strengthen the spirit
            of collaboration and willingness of establishing
            associations. By adding a subcomponent for such investments
            at midterm, was an important project improvement, yet, not
            totally enough. Successful rural development is a complex
            task that requires support to "upstream and downstream
            activities" linked to agricultural production. To
            overcome this constraint, the supervision missions were
            jointly organized with all donors concerned, for proper
            coordination of project implementation. Other lessons
            address limited resources and a gradual approach to
            development; capacity building for nongovernmental
            organizations (NGOs) and private sector operators;
            understanding the preparatory needs for implementing
            innovations; and, the appropriate Government coordination of
            donor assistance in the sector.

repnme.cdata!:
Cameroon - National Agricultural Extension
            and Research Program Support Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Agricultural Extension and
            Research Program Support Project will seek to improve
            farmers' agricultural productivity and incomes through
            providing support to an integrated, farmer-orientated
            agricultural extension system and a demand-driven research
            system. The project consists of six components. First, the
            agricultural extension component will include participatory
            diagnosis of farmers' production problems, transfer of
            farming techniques, particularly to resource-poor and women
            farmers, and monitoring of the progress of extension and
            research activities. Second, the agricultural research
            component will strengthen IRAD (Agricultural Research
            Institute for Development) research capacity, support
            operating cost of on-station research work, and train IRAD
            research staff. The third component will support staff
            training, assess the market for private agricultural
            advisory services, and improve human resource management.
            The fourth component will assist to develop contacts between
            farmer groups and private sector supplies of agricultural
            inputs and crop processing equipment, traders, industrial
            purchasers of agricultural products. Fifth, the village
            community initiatives pilot project will assist village
            communities to identify and agree upon rural development
            priority problems and help the various services and
            development organizations to provide the quality services
            needed. The sixth component will support project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Cameroon - Agricultural Extension and
            Research Program Support Project : Environmental Assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The agriculture sector is predominant in
            the national economy of Cameroon. The Agricultural Extension
            & Research Program Support Project was created to
            increase the agricultural production of small-scale farmers,
            to initiate agricultural extension services that would be
            respective of specific provincial environments, and to
            finance education in order to produce more agricultural
            extension specialists. The project was also designed to
            strengthen the links between research and agricultural
            extension services. This environmental assessment lists
            these environmental risks: (i) increased toxins through the
            improper use of chemical products, namely non-organic
            pesticides and fertilizers; (ii) water pollution caused by
            the improper use of such chemical products; (iii)
            atmospheric pollution caused by fires on land set aside for
            agricultural use; (iv) nutritional negligence caused by
            farmers selling all of their produce and not reserving
            sufficient amounts to address nutritional needs; (v)
            deforestation caused by expansion of farm lands into forest
            areas; and (vi) threats to biodiversity through the use of
            pesticides. It is hope that these risks will be mitigated
            through education on the use of pesticides and fertilizers,
            the engendering of respect for the environment, and the need
            to create food reserve for small-scale farmers.
